 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סְאוֺן‎</span> ?] **noun [masculine]** ==sandal, boot of soldier== (probably loan-word from Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šênu***</u></abbr>, ***shoe***, ***sandal*** (of leather), [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 634</sup> [[BDB#Wkl|Wkl]]<sup>Tel Amarna, Glossary, whence</sup> (denominative) ***šênu, put on sandals*** [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>l.c</sup>.; compare Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סֵינָא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, ***sandal*** (verb denominative <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***sandal***); — probably construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כָּלסְֿאוֺן סֹאֵן‎</span> [[Isa.9.4|Isa 9:4]] ***every boot of one tramping*** (absolute [[BDB#Du|Du]] al).
